intro: Gentiana aristata subsp. aristata, commonly known as the Alpine gentian, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
